intro: Everardia erectolaxa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf everardia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with five petals. Everardia erectolaxa is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
